Superbly simple . We visited several museums in Hanoi and found this to be the easiest to follow, most informative and most memorable. By presenting the role of Vietnamese women throughout history, zoning in on their daily life and also highlighting their role in the war, this museum presents a national heritage that's unique and important. Must visit.

It was worth visiting. If you are a person who love antic and historic things then he should visit this place. Though it has things which belong to women only, but still you find not waste visiting here.
Very interesting. The visit was very interesting & showed what women getting together can do, this placed was run by women & all items in the shop/factory were made by the women. Well done.

Informative. We went here on our last day on the recommendation of our friends. So glad we did. The presentation was meticulous and the short video presentations throughout the museum were worth watching. It was a good way to end our short stay in Hanoi.

Perfect for sunny or rainy days. With three floors packed with history and present day stories, it was worth the time. All signs are available in English and it is easy to learn all you want to know about thje role of women in Vietnam's history and culture. I appreciated their exhibits on traditional dresses, marriage rituals and farming. Old propaganda posters from the war era were interested with translation provided.

women's force. This museum show me a lot of women's history,culture,force and any other with high efficiency.It has good impression at the entrance hall that has fantastic display.and then I could became to know women's force in Vietnam.I've never known that Vietnam had a parson who was called "Woman Viet Minh General"Vietnam might be build with women.
Excellent museum. Very inspiring Museum for women and men! Lots of photographs and descriptions of women's work over the years, traditional costumes and lifestyles.
Every country should have one. Very informative and high quality museum. Great way of putting forward the important roles women have played in history. The parts from the wars were especially good.

One of our favorite sites in Hanoi. When planning our trip to Hanoi we had not originally planned on visiting the Vietnamese Women's Museum. So glad we did include it, because we found it beguiling and fascinating and it ended up one of our favorite memories of that fascinating city. Excellent exhibits about women in all walks of life in Vietnam, from tribal villages to the large cities. The stories of women revolutionaries was especially well told (especially the exhibit about life in the tunnels), and the excellent collection of propaganda posters featuring women was really interesting. Don't miss the wonderful gift shop too! A must see.

Must visit. You can't miss this visit. You can see how the vietnamese womens move the all country. Like all the womens move the world. I thing was 30.000 per person with the audio guide included. They close at 5pm sharp. And you need 2 hours to see it all.

The women are hardworking in Vietnam. I admire women in Vietnam for their extreme work capacity. The museum with all the photos from the war of faces of sad and strong minded women that lost their loved ones during the Vietnam war, gave me more insight in Vietnam history and culture.

Worth the time. The museum is extremely interesting and provides lots of artefacts and items to be viewed on display. The sections of the museum are categorised of the following: Birth, Marriage, Family life, Worshipping mother goddess: pure heart - beauty - joy, Heroic mothers of Vietnam, Historic personages, Women in history, Women's fashion, Destiny of today's women, Art projects. Definitely worth a visit.

Ok, but not great. Maybe it's because I expected more about the women's history and their role in society beyond family that I was a bit disappointed. It's more about what the different tribes wear when they get married, and different rituals around childbirth. The most interesting part is where you can see and read about the symbolic women in history.

Well Worth Seeking Out. This Museum is one which all macho men should visit just to get an idea of what the fair sex are capable of. OK there are parts of the museum that are of interest only to those who want to see the fashion and the methods of dress and adornment that have been used in Vietnam over the centuries.However the parts of the museum telling he story of the bravery and strength of the Vietnamese women during the French and American wars will strike terror into the hearts of men who think women should be stuck in the kitchen.I, for one, would not have liked being an American GI in the Vietnam war with these tiny but extremely clever and vicious little women scurrying about in tunnels below my feet only to pop up and potentially kill or maim me.You will be fascinated by the exhibits and enjoy a good two hours especially on a cold wet Hanoi February day

Very informative and interesing. This museum is about Vietnamese women, ranging from culture/societal roles, fashion, historical figures, and other. Mainly relics and artifacts on display as well as photos. Museum was very empty when we visited as this seems to be an underrated museum but it was well worth a visit.

Well done. It was very educating to learn Bout the role of women in Vietnam's history. It continued to reinforce and provide greater insight into some of what we've been observing about the role of women in South East Asia. I was very happy to see they acknowledged this in the way they did with this museum

Fascinating insight into Vietnamese culture. This is a really interesting and well-organised museum, definitely worth a couple of hours of your time when visiting Hanoi. It provides a great insight into Vietnamese culture and the role of women. I found the section on women's roles in war particularly interesting. I don't know if it ever gets very busy, but when I visited it was particularly quiet, so I was able to take my time looking around. Very enjoyable!

Best museum of my trip!. I've been to quite a few museums during my month long trip through Vietnam, but this was by far my favourite! Not only do you avoid a lot of the propaganda that is present in many other museums, but the content is so interesting and there is so much to see. This museum explains the various customs, traditions and struggles that women in Vietnam experience. Overall, a fantastic museum and I would highly recommend it!

Great information. We visited the museum on impulse because the day was cold and wet and were surprised. The museum gives an insight in women's role in Vietnamese culture, with several different ethnic groups through their history up to the American war. Found more information in the museum than we did from any tour guide. Cost 30,000VD each.
Unusual insights. good view of women's roles in society and history. Well worth an hour or two. Especially appreciated understanding of women in American war.
A glimpse into the life of street vendors. Well-organized and attractive displays describing everyday life of Vietnamese families. This was one of our favourite museums in Vietnam.

A must see.. Every single country should have a museum dedicated to woman. The insight into Vietnamese culture and woman's lives was just amazing. Everyone should go to this museum. Everyone. It is really, really special.
I wish every city had a museum like this!. This was by far one of the best places I've visited here in Hanoi! Really gives a look into the lives of women here past and present!
Excellent. Interesting displays of old Hanoi and how it's changed over the years. Shame wasting more, too quick
Great museum to visit. This museum was nicely done. It was presented in good taste where women of Vietnam are honored with dignity.

Excellent museum . I'm not normally a fan of museums but I really enjoyed this one! We visited on our last day in Hanoi, only expecting to stay an hour, I think we were there for 2 1/2.An excellent overview & in-depth account of Vietnamese Women's lives. I learnt so much about the Vietnamese women's role in the war and throughout history. A truly remarkable exhibit. A must see in my opinion!

Beautiful and interesting, but lacking depth. The women's museum is a large, modern space that attempts to elevate the value of women in a society that is well, extremely male dominated! Some of the information has been exaggerated in significance in order to give the impression that women are very equal and valued in Vietnamese society. Although female war heroes are given notice, as well as some modern cultural topics such as gender are also touched on, the dark side to Vietnamese culture being male dominated is highly overlooked.

This is an amazing museum honoring women of Vietnam! A must see museum!. This museum depicts almost every aspect of a women's life in Vietnam from tribal life, poor women on the streets and wealthy women.

Well worth a visit. This excellent museum depicts womens role in Vietnam society and culture. It's the memories of the wartime contribution by individual heroic women that is most poignant. Lovely collection of costumes, tribal basket ware and fabric motifs from Vietnamese ethic groups.

Very interesting recap of women's rights in Vietnam. A very interesting albeit small museum capturing women's rights and way of life in Vietnam. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here and learned a lot about women's role in this generally patriarchal society.

Interesting insights into the importance of women in Vietnam. Three floors of insight from traditional fashion, marriage and working lives along with the importance of women in the wars and fighting. I'm no history buff but found it interesting. Give yourself 60-90 minutes depending on your level of interest.

Pleasant Surprise. My Hanoi Kids guide brought me to the museum – I’m glad because I would not have gone otherwise. I enjoyed learning about marriage traditions, dress, and worshiping the mother goddess as the information on the role of women during war.

An interesting and pleasant surprise. Didn't quite know what to expect from a women's museum in Vietnam, but thoroughly enjoyed the hour or so spent wandering around this museum. It's easy to walk to from the Old Quarter (where most travellers stay), and well worth an hour or two of your time.It is a contemporary exhibition and a mix of objects, videos, pictures and texts (also in English). The floors showcase different subjects, e.g. tribal life for women, women in the Viet Cong.The museum is modern and contains surprisingly little state "propaganda" (though obviously there is some). It gives you an overview of women in Vietnamese history and their lives today.The gift shop is also pretty good.
Go to the third floor first!. This is an interesting museum, in my opinion, if you're shot on time the third floor is the one to visit! It portrays the role of women in the war.

Worth the visit. The museum is dedicated to researching, collecting and exhibiting the life stories and experiences of Vietnamese women. Entry is 30,000 VND. I easily spent a good 1.5 hours looking at all the displays. Quite fascinating and a good way to escape the unseasonably cold and wet weather that has hit Hanoi.Tip: there is cute little patisserie across the road, called Madame Huong, 39 Ly Thoung Kiet, which has delicious treats

War time exhibit most interesting. Vietnamese women are tough and this museum makes that point very well. Most interesting is the war time exhibit to see how women were involved in the war effort. Other than that it may not hold your attention for too long.
Loved this museum. Spent am ce morning at this museum. A good glimpse into the culture and traditions of the Vietnamese people, family life and position of women in the war and society now..
Very intriguing museum. Wonderful exhibits of ethnic dress and marriage and maternity. We found the exhibits of the women involved in the fight for independence extremely informative and intriguing.

not worth it... Me and my husband went to this museum, waiting for 10 minutes before open. Its dissapointed... nothing special, smelly, dirty, spooky and not worth it at all. We were inside for few seconds and then went out.
Worth a visit. We spent a couple of enjoyable hours in here and there was plenty to see about women's culture. Worth a visit
Done in an hour. It s a recognition to vietnamese women s sacrifice. Do it quickly and check the box, but don t expect sthg fabulous. It a close to the prison which is more interesting.

This is a must!. An incredible insight into the world of women in Vietnam. Something for everyone with fashion throughout the ages and ethnic groups, the role of women in society - matriarchal vs patriachal, and the role of women during the war. It's the first museum dedicated to women that I have ever visited - girl power at last! Allow a couple of hours to see everything - there are other temporary exhibitions too....

Worth the time. Wasn't exactly sure what to expect, yet culturally this was a good experience. The museum does a nice job of showcasing Vietnam's cultural diversity from a feminine point-of-view. The period artifacts including clothing and posters gave me a new perspective of Vietnam and women's role in politics and the military.

Always interested in what women do!. We were happy to find this museum, it was great! Spent at least a couple of hours. It was not crowded the afternoon we went. Enjoyed the video about the women street vendors which taught us a lot about their lives. The art on the top floor wasn't that appealing to me, but still it was interesting to see what contemporary women artists are doing. The exhibits of the "famous" women of the struggle, including those who fought in the American War, was especially touching. We liked learning about this point of view. In contrast was the floor that depicted more "typical" womens' lives, from birth on. Well worth a visit! Buy a few souvenirs in the gift shop!

One of the most impressing museums in Vietnam.. Getting a very good view on womens life and their role in the army. Also the gallery of women who got a medal because they lost familymembers in the war was very impressing.

First timer to Hanoi, a must to visit and understand why most of the hawker are women in Hanoi.. Vietnamese Women's Museum-A must to vist if Vietnam is tour first visit. To understand why most of the women are out there working....dont see the men except you see men working as taxi and treshaw driver.

Only if you have enough time. The museum it is no bad but .. If you have a lot of time for Hanoi ok go .Old and dusty exhibits nothing very interesting or exiting inside .Is not clear what hapend in a traditional wedding .Just few traditional dusty clothes

One floor dedicated to war heroes.. These women were meat eaters, tough as nails. The stories of capture, torture, escape, and leadership were inspiring. We forget that over time the Vietnamese defeated the Mongols three times, the Chinese 17 times (One in the 80's), the French, the USA, and the Cambodians (The only country to stand up to Pol Pot and stop the killing fields. Women were involved in all those conflicts.

A little gem. Went here on our last day on the recommendation of another couple we met. So glad we did. Not just a women's museum, but a history of conflict - firstly the French and then the war against America. Included wonderful display to textiles and clothing from ethnic minoritiories. Good mix of displays and film.

well worth a visit. this was a well presented and interesting museum, giving an insight into the culture and experiences of women throughout Viet Nam including minority groups.The presentation was meticulous and the short video presentations throughout the museum were worth watching. i felt I learned a lot and it was a good way to end our short stay in Hanoi.

Some interesting facts about Vietnamese women. I found this museum ok - the good thing was that there were plenty of objects to look at. However, the layout was a bit strange and some parts were too propagandist for my taste. Overall, I did learn quite a few things and if you have 30-45 minutes to spare I would recommend dropping by.

A must before your trip to Sapa!. What a great way to showcase Vietnamese women and culture. One floor was all about marriage customs. Another about childbirth and family living. A whole floor dedicated to costumes of the different ethnic groups. Women's lives, in the rice paddies, selling on the streets, cooking, weaving, etc. are all represented with great photos and objects.

A well presented and informative museum about women. This a great little excursion that gives you an insight into the various contributions and experiences of women in Vietnam. The exhibits cover aspects of marriage and birth in various ethnic groups found in Vietnam, working life, fashion and the experiences of women during the war.Highly recommend the street vendor video as it gives you a greater sense of understanding towards the various women with the conical hats wandering the streets of Hanoi.

A must visit. This is a great museum; in particular the political history of anti - colonial and revolutionary women. A great social history museum. There's also sections on birth, marriage and family life navigated via the many different ethnic groups. This too is interesting - especially the matrilineal groups. There's a 3rd floor on fashion but I didn't bother climbing the stairs for that - not my cup of tea. But in terms of the social, economic and political history of women in Vietnam, this is a great museum and a most do while in Hanoi.

A very nice museum in Hanoi!. I really loved this museum. I visited there three times and at each time, I learnt more about different subject: Women work, traditional wedding and birth, Women War and spirituality. If you have only one museum to choose in Hanoi, I recommend you Vietnamese Women's Museum of course!

Very interesting, well organized museum with a lot of information about Vietnamese culture. I loved visiting this museum and spent several hours there. There are different floors with different themes so you should have enough time for it. But there was a lot of information, everything was translated in french and english. And the subjects are a whole but are still divers. It is really worth going there if you want to learn something more about the life of the vietnamese people.

Wowee!. I thought this was a great museum! We were very interested in pretty much every section. Some interactive exhibits, but mostly just great information and artifacts displaying the lives of many different Vietnamese women. Very well done, worth a good look. Also, the art gallery at the top has a mirror ceiling, which makes for a fun time.

Displays many ethnic groups' history of women in Vietnam. I actually went to the museum today with my two friends. We took a motorcycle there and it was easy to find. There were no traffic in the parking with quick ticket service. It was pretty amazing to see all the delicate details of the items, clothes, and personal biographies. But, I really enjoyed the pictures and dates that showed the lifestyle of family, marriage, and children. I was amazed by the stories as well as the different ethnic minorities mentioned in organized manner. The building itself was clean and designed well for tourists to walk in chronological order. Each floor consisted of the themes such as children, marriage, worship, and then vietnamese fashion. I really enjoyed the walk around the floors. There were also a variety of displays in forms of videos, pictures, and objects. All in all, I felt well informed, coming out with new insight of Vietnamese culture of women.

Learn a lot about Vietnam through the women! Lovely. Lovely museum! Very colorful and easy to see everything in one hour. A great way to learn about Vietnam's history and culture through the women.Each floor has a different subject: fashion, family life, history, etc,..We are really glad we went in!**Students pay half price!
Interesting. Worth a visit. Good for an hour or so. Get kind of tired of all of the propaganda after a while. Seems to be mostly displays of clothing.

It's all about the party!. Interesting museum. Dedicated to Vietnamese women of all stripes, but primarily related to activities associated with the people's struggle to over come the oppresser. All shades of life from working to marriage. Interesting stop. Works h seeing in Hanoi.

Best museum in town. To enter you pay 30000 or 40000 dong. This museum has four floors dedicated to the life of Vietnamese women. Each floor focuses on a particular theme - war, family, culture and religion. Best museum in town.
Impressive. One of the best museums we've been to recently. Great depiction of the role women play in Vietnam particularly during the war periods. Amazing and detailed.

Very good insight into the lives of women. Each display is translated into English. The best floors for me were the roles of women during war (including the photos of mothers who had sacrificed a high percentage of their families to the war eg one women had ten sons killed) and the jobs of the modern women. Take the time to watch the video on the lives of the street sellers. You will look at the ladies selling goods on the street in a different way.
Amazing museum. This was a hidden delight we chanced upon while walking through Hanoi and we are so glad we found it. Make sure you go there , it is amazing.

Best museum in Vietnam!. This museum is a must visit in Hanoi, to see the stories of all the women who dedicated their lives to the war! It is also probably one of the most well curated museums, with interesting stories and facts about the life of a woman right from birth all the way to marriage, motherhood and beyond. One can easily spend 3-4 hours reading about the various cultural and religious practices as well as the role of women in Vietnam! Highly recommend!

Very interesting look at many different Vietnamese women. A fascinating museum full of beautiful costumes and lots of information on the myriad of women found in Vietnam. Much historical information and some hands-on exhibits kept us interested. A worthwhile visit.

So interesting!. I can think of a few museums in Vietnam that could do with a lesson in museum layout from this place!Such an interesting museum, logically laid out, really visually appealing. The museum's divided into 3 sections over 3 floors: marriage, birth, and an exhibition about Mother Goddesses on the 1st floor, women in Vietnamese history (mainly during the French Occupacion and the American War) on the 2nd floor and traditional clothing on the 3rd floor.The information is in Vietnamese, English and French. The translations are really good! So so interesting reading about various rites in different tribes around Vietnam, as well as several heroines during the wars. Very informative, but nothing too heavy to take in.Thoroughly recommended!
New perspective. Enjoyed the museum. Gave a new perspective on the war and generally the role of women in Vietnam. Worth a visit.

One of favorite attractions in Hanoi. A guide recommended this museum to us and we were happy that we went. It was a small museum, very manageable to see everything which was great. We learned a lot about Vietnamese culture in each exhibit. My favorite one was the women's role in the Vietnam War, or American War. This was insightful and well thought out. But also the exhibit on women street vendors as it gave you perspective on these people and made you more empathetic to them and what they are doing.

Interesting and inspirational. I loved this museum. It's beautifully put together and covers a huge range of subjects from a woman's role in the family, marriage, children etc to the invaluable role women played during both 20th century wars. It brought a lump to my throat several times! Think of it as a study of people, family and society, not just women if the title doesn't appeal! Nice gift shop too offering products to help support female street vendors.

Very interesting and well displayed!. This museum shows the womens role in society through the vietnamese history. I found it very interesting to see! The small videoes was nice to get more information without having ro read a lot of text, as this oftwn gets boring after a while. I especially liked the two top flores with women fashion and art. Worth a visit!

Really interesting museum. This museum was recommended to us by our local guide and we're really glad we went. Several floors dedicated to the various ways that women have influenced life in Vietnam - from child raising, feeding, fashion, working and fighting. 11 year old daughter also enjoyed it.

Amazing museum - esp women's in the war. Gave a fascinating insight into women's role in Vietnam historically. A lovely exhibition about the Mother GodessHighlight was the exhibition on women's role in the War - we didn't know the extent to which they were involved and had great photographs and personal stories.Very good value for money - super cheap
Well organised exhibits with interesting, diverse content. Great for a birds-eye view into the various cultures in Vietnam, as well as the role of women in society over time. Well worth a visit :o)

Eye opener. This is a good little museum to visit for a couple of hours. Not knowing alot about Vietnam's history it was interesting learning about different roles women have played, particulary during war times. Gaining another perspective of what life was like, and for rural villages still to this day.

Well worth visiting . For 30,000VND you won't get a better way of trying to understand Vietnam and it's women. Allow 3 hours for a fascinating journey. The ground floor starts with Family Life, moves to Marriage on the next floor. Given that Vietnamese society is made up of 53 different ethnic groups, each with its own traditions and cultures, the explanations, in English and French as well as Vietnamese, are clear and concise. The next floor moves to the role of Vietnamese women in war (they'd had a few..) and is enlightening. The following floor is given to Vietnamese fashion, both traditional and contemporary, and the top floor is given to temporary art exhibitions. If nothing else, you'll think twice when you next pompously reject the entreaties of a street-seller who she almost begs you to buy a few bananas. She's looking for 20000Nvd to help keep her family alive.

History from a female point of view. A fascinating museum covering many different aspects of Vietnamese women's lives: Marriage, Birth, Clothing, Home and Work, as well as information about some of the war heroines. The rituals respected by different ethnic groups were particularly interesting. Sadly, the section concerning the wars contained the usual patriotic propaganda and to some extent glorified the Vietnamese efforts in the conflicts.

A wonderful museum with a picture into daily life. My daughter loved the exhibit on mother goddess worship, with videos, sample altars, explanations. The videos of women doing great things were powerful, and the fashions and information of matrilineal tribes was fascinating. My 8 y.o. found the floor of Women in History (mostly war related) at little too much, but enjoyed about daily life. Had a small discovery room that wasn't staffed, but had a few things to dress up in. A nice morning, easy walk from hotels in the old quarter. Very inexpensive, too, like all museums in Vietnam.

An excellent insight into the lives of Vietnamese women.. Very informative museum about the lives of Vietnamese women during history,childbirth,marriage and death. The stories of some of the street sellers certainly made you think about how lucky I am.

Girl Power :-). I had two choices for a museum today and I went for the nearest one within walking distance from our lodgings near Hoan Kiem Lake.I was glad to have chosen to see this with my mom. First, its said to be located on the most ancient street in Hanoi and if you like just seeing French architecture, there's a lot of structures which can be seen while roaming around.A blend of good documentation, photographs, vids and display tableaus, I thoroughly enjoyed visiting all the floors. Each level in the building focuses on a different theme such as women in history, in family, fashion and some temporary exhibitions on a wide range of topics.They are also open on everyday (as of this writing), so its a bonus because some countries have the museum close on that one day.Ticket was VND 30,000.
Worth a look . We found it interesting. Particularly the rituals related to marriage and childbirth. Learnt about influential women in Vietnam's history.

A Celebration of Women. This multi-storey building highlights a number of areas of interest to women, such as woman heroes during war, fashions, and their roles in different groups. I thought the exhibits were well presented, and were from a perspective one does not usually get in a traditional museum.

It's not surprising that Vietnamese women play a huge part in the culture and history of their country.. It's no secret that women play a huge part in the daily life wherever they are, but as Americans who knew of what we called the Viet Nam War, we were not aware how important their role was in helping their country win their own 'War of Liberation'! This modern museum is very interesting and should be on your 'short list' of sights to visit while in Ha Noi.
Great Museum!. My husband and I really enjoyed this museum. A great overview of the role of woman in Vietnam and throughout history. Super informative and well presented. Highly recommend!

Fascinating, intriguing and pretty damn cool.. It was quite confusing to get there. It didn't look at a traditional museum from the exterior. It looked pretty modern. When I visited, there was some sort of a farmer's market under a massive tent just outside the museum. So it was quite a treat for tourists like me! They had about 5-6 levels, I think. Each level got more interesting. I especially love the section where they talk about women in military and how they celebrated them. They're so exceptionally fearless and brave. It's kind of ironic how women of the 21st century in Vietnam has regressed just a bit. A guide I spoke to during my trip, said that it is most important for a woman in vietnam to know how to cook. Overall, it was a educational and informative museum that took me through the evolution of women in Vietnam. I'd say take your time to go through every section, it will open your eyes and minds to their culture. The exhibition had a nice flow from section to section. For 30,000 dong, you'll learn alot!

A beautiful museum of Vietnamese women through the years. This was a wonderful addition to our visit. There are the various ethnic women's traditions, role of women in the wars, women in marriage and other ceremonies. It is easily accessible, very modern and fresh in how it displays Vietnamese women through the ages.
Visit . Worth a visit. Good overall view of the role of women in Vietnam. Good information in a number of languages.
Fascinating, especially the section about childbirth. A very interesting museum with well written explanations of the exhibits. It offers a fascinating insight into the culture.

Good place to reveal life on Vietnamese women. My wife suggested visiting this place. I had not expected to see any unusual stuff there, but the museum shortly changed my forecast. Every single floor was attractive and intriguing. I got through the whole exhibition from the textile to the religion, and everything was interesting. The secret of such experience is entirely open: the museum was organized excellently, and every showpiece was supported by a short and well-written entry in English.
Surprisingly interesting . Low level propaganda. Well crafted exhibits. Well worth taking the time to visit. While in the area walk another 100m to Starbucks for some good western coffee.

Women Power, Past and Present . This is a great museum featuring exhibits on women and marriage, childbirth and family life in both modern and traditional Vietnam. There is a wonderful room dedicated to the worship of the Mother Goddess as well as a whole floor dedicated to the military sacrifice of Vietnamese women. Informative videos are strategically placed throughout the museum, don't miss the one on women street vendors.
interesting!. Very interesting museum with lots of real stories of women and their lives and sacrifices during the war period.

A Museum well worth visiting. A comprehensive look at the role women have played in Vietnamese society. The exhibits are well documented so touring by oneself is easy. Especially interesting was the documentation of the participation of women during the war years.

Worth a visit . We had a couple of days to explore Hanoi and we were glad we stopped into the Vietnamese Women's Museum for a better understanding of how women helped in the war. If you've got the time it's definitely worth the stop.
Interesting, depending on your interests. Nice exhibitions and everything was clearly explained. Some of the videos and displays were quite impactful.

Such a Gem!. Talk about an unexpected and awesome gem in the heart of Hanoi. You can see how much work went into the design and layout of this museum and whoever the curator was did a really fabulous job. Each floor has so much information- give yourself plenty of time to check it out (we went around 4pm and didn't have time to make it through the whole thing before 5- it was so interesting!) Definitely worth the entry fee on this one!

A wonderful record of the power of Vietnam's women.. The museum is a little hard to find, my xe om driver went right past it. The entrance is set back from the street. It's a paltry 30,000vd to enter and worth every penny. I loved the way each section was set out, the exhibits were well presented and the information was enough to pique my interest. Being able to 'try your hand' at the corn grinder, carry baskets and head wrap gave me a giggle and huge respect for the physical strength of the remarkable women whose lot is to labour like this on a daily basis. I truly felt like a spoiled westerner. The gift shop was great, interesting items at reasonable prices. Don't miss it.

Educational . If you have a spare 11/2 hours come and have a look around this museum. Very interesting and an insight into Vietnamese culture. I particularly like the struggle for independence level, interesting stories of some brave people.

Power to Vietnamese women. I loved this museum - it gave me so much understanding and respect of the rituals, marriage traditions and the important role women played in the American war. A must-do ...

Dedicated to Women. I have never come across a museum thats dedicated to women. Hanoi's Vietnam Women Museum showcases women's contribution toward the country's growth, narratives of women working in the paddy fields, workers, mothers, businesswomen, teachers etc. The museum is spread over 5 floors having 3 sections eg. women in family, women in history and women's fashion. Its must must visit for people going to vietnam.
Great spot to visit. We really liked this museum and you can easily spend an hour or two there. Exhibits are well done we learned a lot.

A must see attraction. This museum should be on your to do list in Hanoi. Gives a great insight to women's role in the shaping go Vietnam, very informative. I learnt a lot from my visit. And the story of the women street sellers is heartbreaking!

Amazing!. Throughout all my travels, I have never seen a museum dedicated to the women of their country things that represent the variety roles they played and currently play in history, family life and the arts. This was one of my top experiences in Vietnam. I learned so much about the women of Vietnam. The museum has 5-6 floors and is beautifully put together. This is a must see!

Excellent . This museum is well worth a visit. It will give you an insight into the cultural importance of women in Vietnam. I was most interested in finding out about the street vendors. Costs 30000 Vietnam Dong to enter. It is close to hoan kiem lake. About a 5min walk.

women's museum. it is a must see for anyone who is interested in understanding the role of the women in vietnam through ages in domestic life as well as the working women. the place has information which is self explanatory

Stop for a peek if you happen to go by. We spend an hour at the Vietnamese Women's Museum. I wouldn't recommend that you go out of your way to visit it but if you are close by then it's worth an hour's visit.

Very informative. A really well done museum. I especially enjoyed the second floor which is devoted to Vietnamese women and their role in the war for unification of the country - known in America as the Vietnam War and here as the American War.
Must see. If you are interested in learning about the women of Viet Nam this is a great place to start. You will learn their history along with their fashions and family traditions.

A wonderful piece of local history. . Highly recommend a visit to the women's museum. It is wonderful to find out a bit of history of the working women of Vietnam as well as current living conditions of the women with is moving and sad. It really made me more aware of vietnams poverty. A must see.

Really interesting stop - worth a look. We wandered through here on a day through Hanoi, I was really impressed with the displays, detail of information and presentation of all the exhibits. Really high standard. Nice gifts in the shop downstairs if you are looking for souvenirs also.

Worth visiting- take yourself around. I really enjoyed this museum and visited by myself. The museum is really well laid out and designed and has sufficient information that you can take yourself around and enjoy at your own pace.
There's so much information about the role Vietnamese women play in society- be sure to catch the video on street sellers for an eye-opening perspective.
Woman's Museum. It was very interesting, I learned a lot. I only recommend if you want to learn more about the women's in Hanoi.

illuminating! . we really enjoyed our visit at the vietnamese women's museum, not only because it offers you a deep insight into vietnamse culture and history. furthermore you can learn about contemporary struggles of women in vietnam. a must visit if you're in hanoi!
Fantastic!. Great spread of information about the role of Vietnamese women in society. Personal favorite part was about their role during the war. Highly recommended!!

Best window on the Viet people. Though supposedly just about half the population, this museum taught us the most about street vendors, goddess worshippers and the various costumes of the ethnic groups.

Excellent Display of Vietnamese Culture. I love this museum. Has plenty of translations and lots of good information regarding the people(especially the women) and culture of Vietnam. Highly recommend going!

Does not meet my expectation. Vietnamese Women's Museum receive such a great review in TA but I found it quite boring. Through very informative, there's nothing that really attract much of my attention. A quick walk around will do if you have time but maybe not if you're here only for a day or two.

Great Museum. This museum is fantastic and has a lot of very interesting exhibits on women's contribution to the various wars of independence in Vietnam. Very interesting to see non-Western exhibit designs, and super informative.
Highly recommended
Great museum!. Great museum to visit (takes about 1:30-2:00 to do the full visit). Very interesting perspective of the place of women in Vietnam's history. Not expensive.
Great stories of contemporary and historic heroines. This museum combines artifacts with stories in a compelling way. The entrance hall of lanterns is a treat by itself.

A worthwhile museum to visit พิพิธภัณฑ์ที่จัดดีมาก เรื่องราวน่าสนใจ. This is a worthwhile museum to visit in Hanoi. It showcases many aspect of Vietnamese women's life including marriage, family and cultural traditions. You will also learn the rich history of women's role throughout Vietnam's long history. The displays are neatly organized and very attractive to see.
ไปแล้วได้ความรู้เกี่ยวกับสตรีเวียดนามตั้งแต่อดีตถึงปัจจุบันมากมายทั้งเรื่องของวัฒนธรรมและความเป็นอยู่ บทบาทในครอบครัวและบทบาทของสตรีในประวัติศาสตร์การต่อสู้ที่ยาวนานของเวียดนาม พิพิธภัณฑ์จัด exhibition ได้ดีเป็นสัดส่วนสะอาดและน่าชมมาก
Culture . I found the visit to the women's museum useful as it give us an understanding of the Vietnamese women's customs. I would recommend.

Vietnamese Women.. Nothing impressive but worth visiting. Its a 20 minutes walk from the Water Puppets theater. Go through the park to enjoy the garden and lake view. Admission fee of VD30k per person is reasonable.

Worth a visit. Found this museum on the map and took a stroll through the streets to get there - very easy to find. The museum is well planned and very interesting - worth adding to your Vietnam itinerary

Impressive and original. I was pleasantly surprised by this museum and found it fascinating as I've never been to anywhere quite like it. I agree with previous TA reviewers that it is well worth a visit.

Learn About Women's Roles. I found this very interesting. I have heard different views of the role of women in Vietnam. I found the different ethnic roles quite enlightening. This museum covers the life of women from birth to old age. Life here is hard compared to my western life.
Great history and culture!. This is a great place to learn more about Vietnamese traditions, culture and history. It has great records of women's contributions in war.

definitely worth visiting!. Wasn't originaly going to go to, and so glad I did!The video of the street venders alone was worth the visit, and the stories and videos of Vietnamese women, such as one who started a center for over 200 abandoned babies and orphans, or the young woman who translates books despite muscular dystrophy and debilitating pain, and whose courage and spirit are so inspiring -- also the 16th century woman who disguised herself as a man to take the royal exams, and became the first woman doctor. The other exhibit where I spent a lot of time was the one portraying the massive role of women of all ages in the struggles with the French and later the Americans.
Attraction was OK for me but I'm not a museum person.. To me, it was just another museum and I'm not really that kind of person. Some of it was fairly interesting.

All in one: culture, history and modern day stories. Great museum divided in to; women in history (including the war), women in tribal vietnamese culture and women in todays vietnam.
Dont miss the short movies about women street vendors of Hanoi and the storirs about the different traditions around wedding/family.

To learn more about Vietnamese women in the history and in daily life. Many foreigners have said to me that: In Vietnam, the women run the country. this saying is proved after you visit the Vietnamese Women's Museum. Many people are surprised when they learn from this museum about the huge important roles of Vietnamese women in the wars, in working, in building families, in the country development. It also has a good lection of traditional costumes and fashions for Vietnamese women.

Brilliant!. This is one of the most interesting museums I have ever been to. Right from the start, I was moved by the area devoted to Hanoi's (predominantly women) street vendors - their backgrounds, reasons for living this way etc. - and impressed that this contemporary theme was the first gallery you come across. All the other themes were fascinating too - the Mother goddess, the 'Women in War', childbirth and the culture associated with it, to name but a few. And I love the art in the central shaft - the balloon-like hats. It is a 'must-see' in Hanoi, in my book!

Good way to spend an hour or two. Went here when I had some free time in Hanoi as many people recommended it. Was cool to see, and interesting to read all the stories about women in the war. Cheap too! Good way to spend an hour or two if your in the area.

Women's Museum is a great place to visit. I started my visit from the very top floor and worked my way down on each floor reading about the different exhibits. I highly recommend it to anyone interested to learn about the Vietnamese culture.

Amazing Women of Vietnam. Set over 3 or 4 floors. Top being art, then fashion, jewelry & beauty? - the most interesting was the role of women in the Vietnam war - some amazing women. Also bits about weddings & childbirth. Well worth visiting

Interesting. Really enjoyed my visit to the Women's Museum, was good to learn about some non-Western history (coming from the UK) and it complemented my visit to present day Vietnam. I really liked the displays along themes such as marriage, work, motherhood, and it was also a nice peaceful place to escape the crazy streets of Hanoi for a couple of hours!

Great museum!. This museum is modern, well cared-for, and is a great way to learn about the lives of Vietnamese women, from revolutionary activity to the customs of different ethnic groups to a unique take on fashion. Plus a great museum store.

Worth a visit if you have free time.. An interesting look into Vietnamese woman and their roles in society. Spent an hour or two so looking at the exhibits. Not the top of my list but ok. The displays are well laid out.
nice cozy. it shows many things abouts womens culture in vietnam. there is traditional clothes, marriage, and even their part in vietnam war

Amazing stories of resilience. This museum is certainly worth a visit if you want to see a historical and contemporary perspective of the resilience and strength of the women of Vietnam. There are a couple of great videos outlining the stories of women's' bravery and courage during the wars and one about the street vendors and their struggles. We spent a couple of hours there and it was extremely worthwhile. If you are going to Sapa there are also some great pics about ceremonies and culture.

Interesting and moving. It is a well put together small museum, showing not only aspects of the changing role of women in Vietnamese society, but tools, clothing, and everyday items. The exhibition dealing with women involved in Vietnam's revolution and wars of independence against the French, twice, and the later struggle with the USA were particularly awe-inspiring, but the small display dealing with the mothers who lost their sons and daughters to the wars was quite distressing. I was glad I went because it was so informative, if my mother had been still alive she would have applauded it and loved it.

Very interesting and not too long. A simple museum that shows some aspects and customs of women in the Vietnamese Society. I really enjoyed the floors dedicated to the birth, and the newborn, as well, the floor dedicated to Vietnamese Women during the Vietnam War.
best museum in Hanoi. Loved this place, spent a great morning here looking at the influence the beautiful ladies have had on this country and it's landscape, don't miss this

Fantastic display. Fantastic museum on the history of Vietnam's women - worth the visit and good value entry . I likes the level describing the heroic feats of the women during the American war - amazing to witness through the eyes of the photographers

Fascinating. We spent longer than we expected to here. The museum was most interesting and covered all aspects of life for women in Vietnam. It was visually stimulating and and also interesting from a historical viewpoint. We learned quite a lot.

They did a good job on this museum!. By and large I have found the museums in Vietnam lacking in design, exhibits (old style displays etc) and information (they tend to present one dimensional views of events and history). This museum may have a touch of that, but it is very informative about cultural norms and traditional Vietnamese family life. I went there is a guide from Hanoi Free Tours and it was enormously helpful--she knew the museum very well and guided me through, explaining things and pointing out the important exhibits, answering my questions, and offering more in-depth explanations. Saved me having to read my way through it which can get tiring. Exhibits and displays are better than other Vietnam museums I've been in.
An interesting visit. Not my usual cup of tea but interesting all the same. Not somewhere we would have thought of visiting ourselves, but thanks to Asia Top Travel for bringing us here.

Must see in vietnam. I loved this museum because it highlighted women's contribution to Vietnamese history and culture. The staff were kind and gracious and I especially enjoyed the marriage and fashion exhibitions. It was also not very busy so we could enjoy the exhibits more.
OK lah :). Musuems like those in Europe should always be free :) Anyway, it was ok for us, not a lot to see and was ok for a 1 hour visit :)

A new perspective. Easy to find in the French Quarter. Nice cafe in the front courtyard. The exhibits really connected me to the culture of Vietnam and I left with a greater appreciation for the women whom I passed in the streets working everyday. I suggest going early in your stay so that you gain a better perspective and can appreciate your experiences more fully.

Fantastic interesting and enlightening museum. This museum is well laid out, with lovely clear displays, a good amount of translated materials, and an eye opening point of view offered on the lives of women in Vietnam throughout the years. Really interesting. Thoroughly recommended.

Worth a visit!. My mom and I loved our visit here. We learned so much more about Vietnamese history and doing so through the lens of women was an interesting perspective. We took our time going through the museum - the floor on birth and marriage customs was particularly fun - but you could easily spend a bit less time. One of our favourite activities in Hanoi during our 3 day stay.

Guided visit as part of city tour. Recommended visit. Fairly stark building with 4 floors of exhibits. You will learn about women in Vietnamese society, marriage customs across the ethnic groups and see many costumes. The piece de resistance however is the 3rd floor with stories and artifacts of women in the recent conflicts. Very powerful exhibit.

Memorable visit. Very moving and insightful. This was done very well. Simple. High quality good layout and explanations. I really learned allot. Simple clear short videos. Good quality clear exhibits Overall excellently done

One of interesting museum in Hanoi. Vietnam is not museum country like France, Italy or other countries in Europe. In my private opinion, in Hanoi the museum of Ethnology is best, and Vietnamese Women's museum is one of museums you should visit, there are some interesting information about Vietnamese women in the past and ethnic minority people.

Must see. The museum does a great job in depicting and explaining the role of women in a variety of Vietnamese ethnic communities. The costumes and artifiacts are well displayed, and the videos are engaging. Don't miss the one on women who work the flower market; moving and honest about poverty and hard work.

Interesting museum. Though the museum of Ethnology has more information on the various ethnic communities of Vietnam, the Women's museum gives a good insight into daily life of women in both rural communities and their role during the French/American wars. There's a variety of displays: artefacts used in daily life, costume displays, photos and films, and enough variety of subject matter to be interesting to a broad range of people. Spent around 1-2 hours there, would have been longer if it had not been such a humid day (the fans weren't able to keep the whole museum cool).

Something different. Really Nice museum About the woman off Vietnam. From marriage in different tribes, till childbirth, career's and fashion. All exposed in a real museum building, big and spacious. Between all pagodes and war historie a Nice something else to do

Informative and interesting!. We visited the museum on the recommendation of friends and were not disappointed. It was informative and genuine in it's historical portrayal of women's role in Vietnamese history.

Interesting, but I did wonder about bias. We stopped in for a quick visit and read through the displays on the first two floors. Very interesting at times, but I did wonder if there was a bias inherent in some of the displays.

Informative. We were recommended by a Saigon resident to visit this, and it was very informative. Not fun or interactive like some modern museums, but gives a clear sense of the various cultures within this country and each ones customs with respect to its women.

A museum for Women. Amazing museum located in the heart of Hanoi, This place provides you more infos about Vietnamese women during the wartime. It was an unforgettable visit in Hanoi. I highly recommend it

Showcase of Women and Culture. This beautifully designed museum is a testament to Vietnamese women, and culture in general. I highlights all aspect from clothing to historical, through the war years to now. A must see.

Women treasure. Worth a visit to see the women of Vietnam in the past, present and in the future. Amazing to learn about stories of women there. They are heroes in their life without rewards. Definitely come back this place.

A tribute to women. A wonderful tribute to women of all ages and tribes. The exhibition is well put together and walks you through the life of womenhood with as background Vietnamese cultural traditions.

interesting. they had some interesting items especially in the women in war section, cheap entrance, a good place to visit if youre looking for something to do in hanoi- short walk from the center, easy to find, it took us 1 and a half hours to 2 to look around
Insight into women of Vietnam through history. Worth a visit to see what the women of Vietnam have done in the past. Fascinating and also a few surprises.
Worthwhile visit. Very worthwhile for the price to go and have a look for a few hours, was really interesting to see how tough some of these women really have it.
Do yourself a favour. In a country with 54 different ethnic groups trying to give an idea of women in Vet Nam is not an easy task. Good displays, photos, gifts and an especially nice ticket seller

Excellent on Women's contributions to the War and on family life. We had spent time with our tour party and guide at the very interesting Vietnam Military History Museum. In our free time in that afternoon we went to the Vietnamese Women's Museum. We found the section on Women and the War really expanded on our understanding of life during the War.Part of the display had well presented personal histories of individual women who had been involved in a variety of ways including one who was a negotiator at the Paris Peace Talks.This was an impressive exhibition which had been curated to really engage the visitor.An added bonus was in a building in the same courtyard was another excellent exhibition showcasing women inventing better ways of doing a whole variety of things in industry, education, commerce and daily life.

Women of Vietnam. Small Museum spread over several floors with elevator. It has air conditioning.... but it was 93F the day I visited and I was dripping sweat by the time I left.Focuses on the lives of women throughout the country including many of the 50 plus minorities. Displays cover Marriage and Birth, Working Lives of the flower and vegetable sellers, the Mother Godess, Impact of the War and much more, English titles and English Videos.

A great tribute to Vietnamese women. The museum is a short walk away from the lake (the story of Hanoi). The entrance fee is 20,000 VND (15,000 if you can produce a student card). There's four floors, with an elevator, and each room is well laid out with labels in Vietnamese, English and French. The Vietnamese are very proud of the contributions made by women to their history. Well worth a visit!

TOO MUCH gorgeousness. Spent about 4 hours here and only made it to the bottom two floors. A MUST see. Especially poignant was the presentation about the women of warrior spirits, the political prisoners and fighters for national liberation against the French.

Mother Goddess religion/cult was interesting. Admit I was surprised to see that the women's museum focused on child birth, breastfeeding and child rearing. Perhaps a limited view of women 's roles?There was also a description and explanation of the Mother goddess cult, which was interesting.It's worth a visit. Nice coffee shop outside.
Impressive. Was very impressed with the order and structure of this museum. Lots of interesting history to learn about of that's your thing
Very Interesting. Well worth a visit to learn and take in some history! Very Interesting and great way to very easily see what the wonderful women of Vietnam have done and achieved!

Surprisingly interesting. We spent a good hour and a half here. It's a very well organised museum with lots of information in English. It covers the role of marriage, family, work etc, and also has exhibitions of costumes and about the female gods. It's housed in a very nice building too.

Ok, but not impressed. It was not as interesting as I was hoping after reading the reviews. It's still a "classic" museum with stuff hanging around and text to read by yourself. Some parts are more interesting than others, but I still had trouble understanding what was really the women's role in society (except in the different ethnic groups, that was well explained) and potentially their struggles, how it evolved and how it is now. Anyway, it's ok to spend 1-2hours there, but I wouldn't expect too much.

Great insight into Vietnamese Women's Lives. Very interesting exhibits, well laid out. Lots of interesting information and I learnt a lot - definitely gave me a lot more respect for the women selling fruit and other goods in the streets.
Great museum. A really interesting museum that concentrates on women's history in Vietnam but has lots of information on home life, marriage customs and religion.

A must do, good to go there at the start of your stay in Hanoi!. We should have gone there at the beginning of stay in Hanoi as it just shows you what the poor street sellers have to go through to sell their fruit/wares etc. After going there you would be reluctant to barter for goods. The women in Vietnam certainly are the ones that keep the place going, they work so hard! We spent around 4 hours there.

Bring tears into my eyes. It's really good to know how the women in Hanoi/Vietnam since the beginning. How hard they have to work to survive too. It bring tears to me while reading and watching all the clips available in the museum. I would recommend this to travellers who wish to know more of the local culture and their lifestyle.
Extremely worthwhile. Spent a couple of hours here airconditioned! Wonderful display and photos and details of women's roles.

zut vui vey!. very interesting place to visit with an extensive walkthrough of the life of vietnamese women (and culture!) over time! the different floors have different subjects and a million illustrations of vietnamese women and culture. there are different movies to watch and hands on displays to check out. it's a great experience and a great walk in the (women's) shoes of a strong culture.

No need for an expensive group tour. This is a beautiful museum and our visit was enhanced by a free volunteer tour guide. I found the agency on Trip Advisor and asked that this museum be included in our tour. There was an entry fee, but the experience and lovely facility made it worthwhile. Check out their website for details on the themes covered. There is signage in English, but have the fluent English speaking student guide really brought the experience to life. I'm sometimes guilty of skipping signed descriptions, but the background of recently returning from a trip to SaPa really boosted my appreciation for the Family (1st floor) exhibits. We could ask our student guide questions, including details of her own life!

An Eye-Opening Look at the Importance of Vietnam Women. Beautifully arranged museum featuring female ethnic minority Vietnamese women their role in society and the amazing contributions to Vietnam's fight for independence. I particularly loved the beautiful ethnic costumes and the stories of how women as young as 14 fought for their country.My favorite parts included information of the marriage/birthing customs and the role of the Mother Goddess. Excellent coverage in English and a great place to be on a rainy day.

If you enjoy learning about the ethnic heritage of Vietnam you will enjoy this museum. I went by myself to this museum and was glad I did. I was able to take a lot of time to enjoy the many videos, clothing articles and well written articles about many of the 54 different Vietnamese ethnic celebrations. There is a lot about the different styles of wedding dress and daily wear, many of which are still worn today. It isn't a large museum, but give yourself 2 hours if you want to take time to read about the different wear and watch a few of the videos.

Importance of women. The museum highlighted the importance of women in the Vietnames culture as well as the home. The three main floors covered the family, history and costume. It was well laid out, and as long as you followed the correct route, you received the information in an obvious order - we went the wrong way! Very interedting

Nice to see them celebrated. Since arriving in Vietnam I have been stunned by the strength and the work ethic of the women in this county. Everywhere I've been they are working tirelessly and looking after the kids at the same time! SoI was really pleased to see the Women's Museum acknowledge and celebrate the crucial role that women play now, and have played in the past, in shaping Vietnam. I learnt a lot from this museum and would highly recommend it to visitors. We have been to several museums in the country and this one was definitely the best set-out and had the best translations and exhibits. It only took us a couple of hours - but some of the stories are so fascinating you could stay longer. We just bought a book from the shop to take home instead!A must while in Hanoi.

most enlightening and informative featuring hiltribe and female culture. I'm so pleased I took my wife to see this as I knew so little about the culture of VietnamThere was plenty to see with plenty of information boards and some video I now have a much better insight into the lives of the women and the ethnic minorities culture, entering into marriage and bringing up their children and their customs and traditions

Very interesting and informative museum. This museum is great. Brilliant displays, information plaques in Vietnamese, French and English. There are also many videos you can watch which tell the stories in a lot more detail.It was especially interesting to read about how women were involved in defending their country from both the French and American/allies invasions. Some truly remarkable women, many of whom died doing this.The café on the grounds is a nice cool spot to stop for a drink and relax before you leave.

Insightful and easily accessible. So easy to get to, a short walk from the Old Quarter, nearby to the lake, easy to find, and the museum itself was very easy to navigate up it's 4 floors. Very enjoyable to learn about the different cultures of the Ethnic tribes in Vietnam and women's role in each community. Also, entry is only 30 000 VND which is about $2 AUD. Would definitely recommend.
nice place to explore vietnam. I saw that Vietnamese women life is so hard.They are so hard working.IN MUseum they have shown the life of women in vietnam. Intresting place....

Interesting, not what I expected. This is very much an account of women's historical roles in Vietnamese society and in the war. You also get a sense of what many women do these days in society, but it isn't as broad as I had hoped. Nevertheless, I have a much better understanding of Vietnamese marriage and birth, how women were extremely important during Vietnam's revolutionary period and why the ladies selling things on the street are so very keen.I would've liked to learn more about the state of equality between men and women in Vietnam, however.Now to find a museum about men's roles in Vietnamese society...

Interesting!!. I thought it was really interesting for once to get to know the Vietnamese women. After my visit, I could finally, totally understand what women are or were really doing in Vietnam :) Inspiring!
Helpful museum. Very proud of being a vietnamese woman. I was here 2 days ago. I can understand more and more about Vietnamese's women. How hard their life in history and How strong they are.

Celebrating women in Vietnam. A fascinating afternoon. Women from all walks of life are celebrated here and celebrated equally - their place in the family unit, as soldiers, in business and worship of the mother goddesses. Whether this is true in reality I've yet to discover!

Very interesting, cheap entry. My friend and I really enjoyed checking this museum out. To be honest, we didn't spend as much time as we would have liked to read everything because we got really hungry, so I would suggest allowing at least 2 hours to really enjoy it all. After our visit we couldn't help but see the women of Vietnam in a different way, especially those we passed on the streets of Hanoi. So I guess the museum did its job. I would definitely recommend stopping by.Enjoy and safe travels x

Best Museum In Hanoi. I'll admit I didn't visit every museum in Hanoi, but this one is special: each floor is dedicated to a different topic, e.g., women in family; women in history; women in fashion.Each topic is well curated with interesting (visually/historically/practically) objects and documentation, that provide a unique and informative perspective.They're also able to pack a lot into a small space while still providing enough "breathing room" for each object so that it can be appreciated.This is a small, simple museum, it's just very well done.
Interesting!. Very good use of time, interesting and informative museum. My favourite level was the one about women in the war.
It is a must SEE. Go!. I loved it. As a former curator for museums this exhibition was done really well. I learned a lot about Vietnam and its history.
Amazing. Really informative, I learnt a lot about Vietnam generally and about the important women in history and modern day....

Something a little bit different. Being male and not usually a "museum" person I found this place to be both informative as well as being sufficiently different to hold my interest.Thinking Vietnam to be a strongly patriarchal society I was surprised to learn about and see the recognition of the woman both in ancient as well as modern times. My interest was held throughout my visit despite the mainly static images and displays. During the summer time I found the building comfortable to move about in despite (in the main) not being air-conditioned. I came away with a better understanding & appreciation of the contribution women have made to the history & development of the country and found both my time and money for the admission price well spent. Suggest allowing at least 1 whole hour to 'take-in' what is being displayed and interpreted in the exhibits. Remember to check opening times as Mondays it is often closed

R.E.S.P.E.C.T.. I'm an information junkie and avid museum-goer. When I reach a new city, I always visit at least three museums, usually of different types. Nothing is better to me than a constant stream of stimuli, a barrage of new facts and sights. I am but human, however, and the danger of such a method is that I forget so much. I am astonished by how much I have managed to forget in my one small lifetime so far.But I have not forgotten the Vietnamese Women's Museum! It glitters in my memory like the rare jewel that it is. The museum itself is very sleek and modern, skillfully and carefully curated. And the content was remarkable. Every exhibit was tethered to life. I saw religious artifacts and birthing herbs, marriage beds and wartime weapons. The museum managed to capture an image of life as lived by women, all different types of women. So fantastic; so memorable.

Nice surprise!. In our last few days in Hanoi, we were looking for a museum to relax and kill some time. We were surprised by the richness of the history presented in this museum. The quality of the exhibitions was great.

Surprisingly Excellent. This museum offers a 'whole new way' of understanding your experience of Vietnam. The combination of history, social comment and ethnographic material is exceptionally well presented. Very interesting and a really good museum shop.
Worth a visit. We enjoyed our walk around the museum it gave us an insight into the hardships these women endure in daily life

Homage the women who fought for their country. I wasn't sure if I wanted to visit but sure am glad I did. The lay out is done very orderly and makes total sense as you visit each floor of the museum. We always think that men went to war to fight for their country and this is giving women the respect that they surely deserve.
Proved to me the strength of Vietnamese women. This is an eye opener and certainly opened my eyes to the strength and bravery of a whole range of Vietnamese women over time. A must see exhibit

The best museum in Ha Noi!. What an incredible insight into the culture of Vietnamese women through the ages. The beautiful women have had tough times and are so resilient and proud. If you are a women you will find this museum interesting. The museum has exhibits from Vietnamese women over the ages. In this museum is talks about birth, marriage, clothing and feeding their families. It is a good place to learn about Vietnamese women. I would go back again.

Important museum showing various aspects of women´s lives in Vietnam. The museum has different departments: family life, indigenous women, fashion, religion, art, etc. All set on different floors and parts of the building. It is an important and interesting part of Vietnamese history, and I really liked how they had put a lot of effort into the section on women and their role in the war. Not a place to bring kids (I believe).

Unique and Interesting. I was pleasantly surprised by the Women's Museum. First of all, there was nobody there so if you don't like crowds this may be a good option.The displays were good and I learned a lot about the historical and current roles of women in Vietnam society. I also learned a ton about how women's roles within the different ethnic groups.This museum is worth a couple of hours and may surprise you with the amount of information contained in it.
Don't miss!. Fascinating museum - very different to any we have visited before. So interesting to learn about the role of women in the history of Vietnam.

Fascinating. I was throughly impressed there even was a women's museum! The exhibitions are fascinating. I had no idea the women of Vietnam played such a huge role in the occupation and war. There are some amazing women in there! There are 4-5 floors but the rooms are air conditioned and the shop has some great replica's of the posters on display.Very cool. Highly recommend.Entry was 30,000d

Nice museum!. This is a very nice museum! The Museum divide into 3 levels which allow us to view different history of women's in Vietnam and displaying their costume and their tradition. I was very moved by the important role of a women's in a family and portrait strong character holding the family and country together. The entry fee is only $1 and it has some really good information and audio-visual displays. Highly recommended!

Set aside a couple of hours for this place - all in English which helped me!. Very good museum with about 4 floors dedicated to the women of Vietnam - fashion, motherhood, the wars and their contribution, and their lives in general. Nicely laid out and A/C very easy to spend a few hours here
Fascinating. Really well-organized museum on the history and culture of the country through the perspective of the Vietnamese women. I loved it. Very great artifacts and great presentation.

Interesting but not great. The first section about Vietnamese family life was very interest. The other parts about fashion and women in Vietnam's history were not well done. The history part would lead you to believe that women had no role in the country's history before 1930.

Best museum ever. I and my mom absolutely loved this museum. It not only gives you insight in the life of women in Vietnam, but also in the culture. The museum is also organized in such a great way, that it is a pleasure to walk there. It was really perfect.

Don't skip this one. This museum is the best thing to do in hanoi (not counting overnight trips to halong bay, etc). It is beautifully laid out and features a good mix of media, from photography and video to physical displays of items like traditional clothing. Each floor is dedicated to a different aspect of Vietnamese women's lives and their contributions to the culture. My favorite was the floor that focused on women's involvement in the war efforts, filling all sorts of roles: nurses, spies, generals. I walked away feeling much better informed about the culture, but also inspired by the stories I'd read.

Great for little girls to explore Hanoi traditions past and present. We brought our 5 year old as a respite from the scorching heat, and were quite impressed with the interactive exhibits and costumery.

A beautiful cultural spot in Hanoi. During my stay in Vietnam I had the privilege to visit and work close with the nice ladies who manage this interesting Museum. It is a nice place where they created a pleasent athmosphere where you can learn about women and their role and influence in the Vietnamese society. A visit to the Vietnamese Women's Museum: a must during your holiday in Hanoi!

Another great museum. for a window into vietnames culture and values, this museum is a must-see. Not only is it about women, it is run only by women from the national women's union. So its presentation of the life of women in Vietnam is nuanced and complex.

Interesting visit. Well organised venue depicting everyday life from a woman's perspective through recent Vietnamese history. Some very moving accounts and great displays. Good shop within the building

Women's Museum. This museum was totally fascinating. It covered roles women have played over time in Vietnam, how their clothing has evolved, and photos of daily work. I found their tremendous input into the War effort, really interesting,

nice way to know more about vietnamese history.. I was alone and i did not have a lot of time so i went to this museum. it is interesting to see how vietnamese population has changed, specially women. you can enjoy beatiful dresses and legends. museum is not very big so you only need one hour, maximum one and a half to finish the visit. it is not the best thing in Hanoi but i found it very interesting. it is not expensive and i like a lot the museum store; there you can find some bags and textile things made by Vietnamese ONG; buy something and you will help a lot of Vietnamese children!

Amazing museum. A really interesting insight into the important contribution of women in Vietnamese society. As an ex-pat living in Hanoi definitely made me envious that Ireland hasn't something similar to celebrate women

Quiet contemplation. Tells the history of Vietnam and the stories of the cultures with an emphasis on the lives of the women involved (well, obviously!) But it is thoughtfully and imaginatively set up, and you certainly don't have to be female to enjoy and learn from a visit. The internal layout of the building is of architectural interest, too.

Exit via the gift shop. This was renovated a few years ago and much of the material here is better presented for foreigners than in many Hanoi museums; most information is in English and French as well as Vietnamese. The museum has several permanent exhibitions including a survey of the clothing and jewellery of Vietnam's 54 ethnic groups and an exhibition about the lives of women street traders. When I visited there was a fascinating temporary exhibition about Vietnamese worship of the Mother Goddess. More about all of this on the museum's website, which can be viewed in Vietnamese, English, French and Japanese. The museum has two additional attractions. The first is a café that sells excellent espresso coffee - it's the second café on the right when you enter the grounds of the museum. The second is the first-rate gift shop on the ground floor. It sells at very reasonable prices art and history books, tote bags, traditional embroidery and other crafts, jewellery, home wares and reproductions of propaganda posters. I spent a couple of hours at the museum and could easily have stayed for longer.

Worth a visit.. This is by far the best museum in Hanoi. Not only does it give a fabulous overview of life of the Vietnamese women but Vietnamese life in general. At times it can be very moving to learn of the strength and the hardships of women in Vietnam but also inspiring to know of their strength and commitment to their community and family. Well worth the visit.

Interesting Museum not found elsewhere. We've traveled all over the world and It's refreshing to find a museum that's dedicated to women. It was an excellent chance to learn about the role of women in Vietnam's history. Make sure to visit the cafe to relax afterwards!

One of the best museums in Ha Noi!. As a history lover, I love wandering around town visiting places where I can learn more about Vietnamese history and culture. Of all the places I've been, this one is the best by far. I love the showcase of each floor, the warm welcome of the staff before and after the tour. The roles of Vietnamese women in real life and history are well-presented. Just love this place and definitely wanna come back.

Beautiful society museum. A very nice museum, very modern and beautiful. It helps getting to know more about Vietnam's history and society throught the stories of women, famous or less so. I highly recommend it !Should take 1 hour to visit.

Women in many roles . I really enjoyed this museum. Good layout and nicely presented. The museum shows Vietnamese women in many roles throughout history. My favorite was in wartime. Brief stories of many women in war time. Also the clothing and fashion was also good. I would highly recommend the visit.

Average. An interesting way to spend an hour, though I did not find it particularly fascinating. While the information was descriptive, it often lacked some explanatory power, like why certain customs are followed. If you have time to kill, it's not bad, but I wouldn't recommend going out of your way, when there are other, better museums in Hanoi.

A honour to Vietnamese women. A history of the part that the Vietnamese women played in the wars and the bravery involved in both raising their families and fighting their occupiers. Some of these women were as young as 16. Very sad and confronting.
